title: CVE6010 Land Reclamation and Ground Improvement | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: This module deep dives into how land is reclaimed in Singapore, and ways it can be further improved through various ground improvement techniques.

CVE6010 Land Reclamation and Ground Improvement
CVE6010 Land Reclamation and Ground Improvement
This module deep dives into how land is reclaimed in Singapore, and ways it can be further improved through various ground improvement techniques.

Effective from AY2025/26 Trimester 2 (January 2026), the Postgraduate Certificate in Civil Engineering will be transiting to Graduate Certificate in Civil Engineering. For more details, please refer to the full notice

This module covers how land is reclaimed in Singapore and how the reclaimed soil can be improved as well as ground improvement techniques for other geotechnical works such as tunnelling and deep excavation.

For land reclamation, the coverage includes the reclamation schemes, fill types, cost, placement process and the improvement of fill in terms of strength and settlement. The design and construction of shore protection structures will be introduced as well.

For ground improvement, the different methods employed to improve the soil properties of reclaimed lands and other difficult soils include roller compaction, dynamic compaction, vibro-replacement, vibro-flotation, surcharge preloading with prefabricated vertical drains (PVD) and vacuum, mechanical stabilised earth, deep cement mixing, jet grouting, and permeation grouting.
In addition to the design and construction considerations covered, the quality control to ensure consistency of the ground treatment and the lessons learnt from case histories are discussed as well.
Civil Engineers, Site Engineers, Field Engineers, Project Engineers
Candidate should possess a bachelor degree in Civil Engineering
Participate in the planning and execution of land reclamation works
Select appropriate soil improvement methods to improve soil strength, reduce permeability and accelerate the time rate of consolidation
Compare, select and design the appropriate chemical ground stabilisation method and required cementitious grout according to the geotechnical application and ground condition
Associate Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Ho Jiahui is an Assistant Professor at Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT). She obtained her PhD in Geotechnical Engineering from the National University of Singapore (NUS) and started her career as a research fellow working on National Research Foundation (NRF) and Land Transport Authority (LTA) projects.  Her research involved deterministic and random finite element analysis of optimized ground improvement schemes, and experimental study on the application of cementitious binders and additives for large-scale urban space exploitation in soft soil conditions. In the area of geotechnics, Dr Ho has a strong interest in soil improvement and geotechnical earthquake engineering. She served as a reviewer for several publications in ASTM’s Geotechnical Testing Journal (American Society for Testing and Materials) and the Journal of Earthquake and Tsunami. Dr. Ho is currently researching on the application of an advanced piling technology in Singapore.
BD Director, Keller Foundations (S.E. Asia) Pte. Ltd.
BD Director, Keller Foundations (S.E. Asia) Pte. Ltd.

Dr. Leong graduated with Bachelor of Engineering (First Class Honour) in Civil Engineering from University of Malaya, Malaysia. He obtained his PhD from the National University of Singapore. He has more than 20 years of experience in Geotechnical Engineering. He has been active in the design and execution of Ground Improvement projects in South East Asia (ASEAN) for Keller like Neste Biodiesel Plants in Singapore and KVMRT project in Malaysia. He is currently the BD Director of Keller Foundations (S.E. Asia) Pte Ltd, overseeing the business development of the Ground Improvement business in ASEAN. He is a member of the Geotechnical Society of Singapore (GeoSS) since 2008, served as committee member since 2012 and Vice President for 2014-15. He was the President of GeoSS for 2016-17. He received the Outstanding Geotechnical Engineer award in 2018 from GeoSS in recognition of his contributions to the geotechnical society and industry in Singapore.
Senior Professional Officer, Professional Officers, Singapore Institute of Technology
Senior Professional Officer, Professional Officers, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Joel Tan is currently a Senior Professional Professor at Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT). He graduated with Bachelor of Engineering (First Class Honour) in Civil Engineering from Swinburne University of Technology, Australia. He later obtained his MSc in Civil Engineering (Specialisation in Geotechnical Engineering) from Nanyang Technological University and subsequently, PhD in Geotechnical Engineering from the National University of Singapore. He has also recently completed Specialist Diploma in Underground Construction with BCA Academy. Prior to joining SIT, he has close to 10 years of practical experience working with local and international consultants, foundation specialist and main contractor.

He was involved in various deep and shallow foundation works, retaining structures, ground improvement works for public and private projects such as MRT Thomson East Coast Line, Downtown Line and mixed development. He begins his career in Malaysia as part of the consulting team involved in design of Centralised Wastewater Management System, Saddle Dams, Industrial Plants, Jetties & Wharfs in areas of piled foundation, seepage & slope stability, consolidation, deep excavation with instrumentation, building impact assessment, geotechnical interpretation and supervision of pile load tests. Dr. Tan area of interests is mainly in numerical modelling and piled foundation. He has also published in International Journal of Geomechanics (ASCE). He is currently supporting the undergraduate and post-graduate program in civil engineering and is also serving as Professional Officer Division (POD) Program Coordinator in Civil Engineering.
Overview on grouting, Jet grouting, Fissure/Fracture grouting, Deep soil mixing
A Certificate of Attainment will be issued to participants who:
Attend at least 75% of the module; and
Undertake and pass credit bearing assessment (worth 6 credits) during the module, which can be stacked towards the Postgraduate Certificate in Civil Engineering
Participants who meet the attendance requirement but do not pass the assessment will receive a Certificate of Participation.
The full fee for this course is S$3,606.88.
Fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.
There are no upcoming course runs at the moment.
Subscribe to our mailing list to learn about the latest dates as soon as they become available.

The Postgraduate Certificate in Civil Engineering is designed to equip engineers with specialised technical and practical skills to help the industry address increasingly complex civil engineering problems in a creative and sustainable way.
What is the prerequisite knowledge for the course?
Students should be familiar with basic geotechnical engineering design methods and rules from Eurocodes.
Is any software required for the course?
Any analysis software used will be provided as part of the course.
Readying SIT's Civil Engineering Graduates for the Future Workforce
SIT's lifelong learning division lays the foundation for Class of 2020 Civil Engineering graduates to attain their Professional Engineering qualification.
This module provides an overview of Singapore geology, soil and rock behaviour, site investigation, and evaluation of field and laboratory test results.
CVE6002 Design of Steel and Composite Structures
This module covers fundamental approaches to designing steel-concrete composite buildings in accordance with EC4.
TE1 – Geology of Singapore and Tunnel Design (Exam-Only Pathway)
This exam-only pathway (TE1 – Geology of Singapore and Tunnel Design) is required for engineers looking to register as a Specialist Professional in Tunnelling Engineering.
This module covers structural stability, dynamic problems, and developing fundamental equations in civil engineering.
This is the second module of a three-module course that prepares candidates for the Specialist Registration Examination in Tunnel Engineering.
TE3 – Tunnelling Operation and Impact Assessment (Exam-Only Pathway)
This exam-only pathway (TE3 – Tunnelling Operation and Impact Assessment) is required for engineers looking to register as a Specialist Professional in Tunnelling Engineering.

Exciting news! We are introducing new micro-credentials in Electrical and Electronic Engineering & Infrastructure and Systems Engineering. Be among the first to know by registering your interest today!
